intro: Brunfelsia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
